item.description:
Urban Permablitz! Portland

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Permablitz (noun): An informal gathering involving a day on which a group of people come together to achieve the following:

  • create or add to edible gardens where someone lives
  • share skills related to permaculture and sustainable living
  • build community networks
  • have fun

 

Join us for a day long implementation of a permaculture design in Portland.

Projects to be completed:

Urban Composter system

Hoophouse for raised beds

Rain barrel set up/ water catchment how to

Sheetmulching in the city

...plus re-purposing of urban materials for outdoor seating/furniture

and Cordwood walking paths

Permaculture design by Post Carbon Designs

 

 

Schedule: 9:00 Gather/Coffee/Tea/Briefing on Work Party Plan for the Day

9:30 Review of Permaculture Design Principles and Homeowner Needs

10:30 Break into teams and work on projects

12:30 Potluck Lunch

1:00 Resume work

3:30 Check-in & prioritize final hour / clean-up

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What to bring! Bring a notebook, camera (if desired), work gloves and boots. Wear clothes that can get a bit dirty. Dress in layers in case things start out cool and warm up over the course of the day. Bring a potluck dish to share and don't forget your potluck "kit" (dish/bowl/utensils/cup/napkin).

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Urban Permablitz! Portland
